title: Product Designer, Native
description: Location Toronto Employment Type Full time Location Type On-site Department Design Who are we? Our mission is to scale intelligence to serve humanity. We’re training and deploying frontier models for developers and enterprises who are building AI systems to power magical experiences like content generation, semantic search, RAG, and agents. We believe that our work is instrumental to the widespread adoption of AI. We obsess over what we build. Each one of us is responsible for contributing to increasing the capabilities of our models and the value they drive for our customers. We like to work hard and move fast to do what’s best for our customers. Cohere is a team of researchers, engineers, designers, and more, who are passionate about their craft. Each person is one of the best in the world at what they do. We believe that a diverse range of perspectives is a requirement for building great products. Join us on our mission and shape the future! About the Native team On this product team, you will be responsible for bringing North to iOS and Android, translating our web experience into native-first interfaces that feel at home on mobile platforms. You'll help define the vision for North Native, determining what to adapt, what to reimagine, and what new capabilities mobile unlocks. This role requires fluency in both web and native design patterns, understanding when to maintain consistency with our existing experience and when platform conventions should take precedence. You'll be shaping the early product experience and design patterns that will serve as the foundation of North Native. In this role, you will: • Own the design process end-to-end for Native experiences. Collaborate with Product on the mobile product vision and translate complex web workflows into intuitive native experiences optimized for iOS and Android. • Balance consistency with our web platform against native platform conventions, making thoughtful decisions about when to align and when to diverge based on user context and platform strengths. • Design with platform-specific patterns and capabilities in mind—leveraging native gestures, notifications, widgets, and system integrations to create experiences that feel truly native. • Partner closely with product managers and engineers throughout the development lifecycle, collaborating on technical feasibility, implementation details, and platform-specific constraints. • Conduct user research to understand mobile-specific use cases, behaviours, and expectations, ensuring Native delivers unique value rather than simply replicating the web experience. • Establish design patterns and guidelines for Native that scale across both platforms while accommodating platform-specific needs and future mobile capabilities. You're likely a good fit if you have: • Product Design Experience: 3+ years designing digital products with a strong portfolio that demonstrates your process, systems thinking, and measurable impact on user outcomes. • Cross-Functional Partnership: A collaborative approach to product development—working closely with Product Managers to identify opportunities, with Engineers to navigate technical constraints and review implementations, and with stakeholders across the organization to align on solutions. • User-Centered Approach: A deep commitment to understanding user needs through research and direct engagement. You drive research initiatives, translate findings into design decisions, and stay informed on industry trends and AI developments that shape the product landscape. • Craft Excellence: Meticulous attention to craft and detail. You're proficient in Figma, build scalable component systems, and consistently elevate the quality of everything you touch. Bonus points for strong visual design skills in typography, layout, color, and composition. • Communication Skills: Clear, proactive communication that keeps distributed teams aligned. You document decisions, articulate design rationale to diverse audiences, and create shared understanding across geographies and disciplines. If some of the above doesn’t line up perfectly with your experience, we still encourage you to apply! We value and celebrate diversity and strive to create an inclusive work environment for all. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are committed to providing equal opportunities. Should you require any accommodations during the recruitment process, please submit an Accommodations Request Form, and we will work together to meet your needs. Full-Time Employees at Cohere enjoy these Perks: 🤝 An open and inclusive culture and work environment 🧑‍💻 Work closely with a team on the cutting edge of AI research 🍽 Weekly lunch stipend, in-office lunches & snacks 🦷 Full health and dental benefits, including a separate budget to take care of your mental health 🐣 100% Parental Leave top-up for up to 6 months 🎨 Personal enrichment benefits towards arts and culture, fitness and well-being, quality time, and workspace improvement 🏙 Remote-flexible, offices in Toronto, New York, San Francisco, London and Paris, as well as a co-working stipend ✈️ 6 weeks of vacation (30 working days!)

title: Product Designer - Agentic Search
description: Position: Staff Product Designer - Agentic Search At eBay, we're more than a global ecommerce leader — we’re changing the way the world shops and sells. Our platform empowers millions of buyers and sellers in more than 190 markets around the world. We’re committed to pushing boundaries and leaving our mark as we reinvent the future of ecommerce for enthusiasts. Our customers are our compass, authenticity thrives, bold ideas are welcome, and everyone can bring their unique selves to work — every day. We're in this together, sustaining the future of our customers, our company, and our planet. Join a team of passionate thinkers, innovators, and dreamers — and help us connect people and build communities to create economic opportunity for all. About the team and the role eBay’s Search, Browse and SEO organization is core to eBay’s business and is at the heart of the buyer experience 'll work with some of the best in the industry to design and build relevant, human and magical shopping experiences. As a Staff Product Designer on our Agentic Search team, you will help craft the future of this critical , foundational, and groundbreaking experience. This is an exciting opportunity to work with leaders across eBay to improve the end-to-end agentic search experience for eBay customers as well as crafting the comprehensive AI experience. We will rely on you to build meaningful relationships with our product and engineering partners, with a focus on craft and execution, creating innovative and intuitive solutions and tackling eBay’s more grueling challenges through product discovery and design thinking. What you will accomplish • Create world-class, user-centered designs and experiences which solve for customer needs, deliver on business requirements, account for technical feasibility and leverage future trends • Use your understanding of user-centered design processes and ability to create prototypes and high quality design work to drive product design for end-to-end projects in agile, cross-functional teams • Operate as a "Co-Founder" within the cross-functional product team by identifying and validating user problems, producing inventive and thoughtful solutions for users and the business, and shipping meaningful product updates that deliver tangible results • Unite multiple AI-related projects into a cohesive portfolio and end-to-end experience for our customers via collaboration with our design system teams, engineers and multiple product management teams • Deliver tested solutions via participation in user research, product discovery & testing What you will bring • 8+ years of professional experience in product design as an IC design lead working across large cross-domain and cross-functional projects which define an end-to-end customer experience • An outstanding portfolio which demonstrates a broad range of design and product strategy across web-based and native applications and consumer experiences • Experience using design thinking methodologies & UCD processes to drive collaboration across agile, cross-functional teams in a large organization • Hands-on experience driving product and concept development, including generative research, storyboarding, user-journey mapping, competitive analysis, prototyping, qualitative interviews and quantitative testing • Ability to synthesize ambiguity, bringing industry trends, research, team insights, business priorities, and partner feedback into actionable UX strategy and design execution • Experience designing AI interfaces or other experience designing with emerging technologies Please see the for information regarding how eBay handles your personal data collected when you use the eBay Careers website or apply for a job with eBay. eBay is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please contact us at . We will make every effort to respond to your request for accommodation as soon as possible. By continuing to browse the site, you agree to our use of cookies. Visit our for more information.

title: Product Designer, Design Systems
description: EvenUp is on a mission to close the justice gap using technology and AI. We empower personal injury lawyers and victims to get the justice they deserve. Our products enable law firms to secure faster settlements, higher payouts, and better outcomes for victims injured through no fault of their own in vehicle collisions, accidents, natural disasters, and more. We are one of the fastest-growing vertical SaaS companies in history, and we are just getting started. EvenUp is backed by top VCs, including Bessemer Venture Partners, Bain Capital Ventures, SignalFire, and Lightspeed. We are looking to expand our team with talented, driven, and collaborative individuals who seek to have a lasting impact. Learn more at www.evenuplaw.com. We’re looking for a Product Designer, Design Systems, to help shape the future of legal tech and push the boundaries of how AI can serve those seeking justice. In this role, you’ll lead complex, high-impact initiatives from concept to launch—designing scalable solutions that power critical legal workflows and equipping personal injury attorneys with the tools they need to advocate effectively for their clients. You’ll partner closely with engineering, product, and AI/ML teams to drive strategy, establish scalable design patterns, and bring clarity to ambiguous problem spaces. This is a high-leverage opportunity to influence foundational architecture, champion design excellence, and define what great looks like in a technically sophisticated, mission-driven environment. You’ll report to the Head of Design and collaborate with a growing team of designers who care deeply about impact, craft, and consistency across products. Job title and level to be determined based on candidate’s background and interview performance. What you'll do: • Lead the creation, maintenance, and evolution of our design system, ensuring consistency, scalability, and adoption across products. • Take ownership of the design process for a product area, from strategy to user flows and interaction design, with a strong focus on reusable components and scalable patterns. • Conduct user research and usability testing to understand internal and external user needs, translating insights into efficient, accessible, and delightful product experiences. • Create high-fidelity designs and prototypes for AI-powered solutions that scale across platforms and support complex workflows. • Collaborate closely with engineers, product managers, data scientists, and AI researchers to ship high-quality features efficiently. • Use your expertise to shape product and design strategy, advocating for system-wide consistency and design best practices. • Mentor and elevate the design craft of the team, fostering growth and maintaining high standards in design thinking, execution, and system adoption. What we look for: • At least 5 years of experience in software product design. • Proven experience creating, implementing, and scaling design systems across multiple products. • Experience building workflow products for specialized power users in a B2B environment. • Experience designing interfaces for AI products. • Deep expertise in Figma, especially tooling for component libraries, system documentation, and cross-functional adoption. • Excellent qualitative user research skills. • Strong written communication skills. • Execution mindset with the ability to set and meet deadlines. • Startup experience and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, growth-oriented environment. Notice to Candidates: EvenUp has been made aware of fraudulent job postings and unaffiliated third parties posing as our recruiting team – please know that we have no affiliation or connection to these situations. We only post open roles on our career page (evenuplaw.com/careers) or reputable job boards like our official LinkedIn or Indeed pages, and all official EvenUp recruitment emails will come from the domains @evenuplaw.com, @evenup.ai, @ext-evenuplaw.com, no-reply@ashbyhq.com or no‑reply@canditech.io email addresses. To ensure fairness and proper consideration, we do not accept resumes or expressions of interest via email or social media messages. If you’re interested in a role, please submit your application directly through our careers page. If you receive communication from someone you believe is impersonating EvenUp, please report it to us at talent-ops-team@evenuplaw.com. Examples of fraudulent domains include “careers-evenuplaw.com” and “careers-evenuplaws.com”. Benefits & Perks: As part of our total rewards package, we offer attractive benefits and perks to our employees, including: • Choice of medical, dental, and vision insurance plans for you and your family • Additional insurance coverage options for life, accident, or critical illness • Flexible paid time off, sick leave, short-term and long-term disability • 10 US observed holidays, and Canadian statutory holidays by province • A home office stipend • 401(k) for US-based employees and RRSP for Canada-based employees • Paid parental leave • A local in-person meet-up program • Hubs in San Francisco and Toronto Please note the above benefits & perks are for full-time employees EvenUp is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to diversity and inclusion in our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Compensation Range: $140.3K - $218.5K

title: Sr. Staff Product Designer - eBay Live
description: At eBay, we're more than a global ecommerce leader — we’re changing the way the world shops and sells. Our platform empowers millions of buyers and sellers in more than 190 markets around the world. We’re committed to pushing boundaries and leaving our mark as we reinvent the future of ecommerce for enthusiasts. Our customers are our compass, authenticity thrives, bold ideas are welcome, and everyone can bring their unique selves to work — every day. We're in this together, sustaining the future of our customers, our company, and our planet. Join a team of passionate thinkers, innovators, and dreamers — and help us connect people and build communities to create economic opportunity for all. About the Team and Role The eBay Live Seller Pillar team is dedicated to transforming the live commerce experience for sellers—from onboarding and streaming to inventory and post-transaction management. As an Sr. Staff Product Designer, you will help deliver strategy and innovation for the holistic Live seller experience. This advanced role establishes foundational design architecture, fosters cross-team alignment and scalability, and elevates design-led influence and seller advocacy across the organization. You’ll report directly into the Senior Manager of eBay Live and work closely with cross-functional partners in design, product, engineering, research, and marketing. You will be a primary driver advancing eBay Live to industry leadership by deeply understanding seller pain points, innovating on design solutions, and integrating Live workflows into core selling experiences. What You'll Accomplish • Lead design strategy, architecture, and vision for eBay Live seller experiences, enabling retention and growth in a competitive live commerce landscape. • Drive end-to-end product design, championing service-design methodologies to define and elevate the Live seller journey (onboarding, pre-stream, in-stream, post-stream, business management). • Collaborate with senior design, product, engineering, content, and research leadership to align roadmaps, optimize workflows, and deliver scalable solutions that benefit sellers and buyers. • Develop and iterate advanced design prototypes and narratives that bring innovative concepts to life for testing and refinement in partnership with Research and Content teams. • Partner deeply with content and research peers to ensure seller perspectives, data, and storytelling inform UX strategy and execution across live commerce touchpoints. • Drive executive-level presentations, storytelling, and crafting of design narratives that clearly communicate opportunities, solutions, and results to senior leadership and stakeholder audiences. • Advocate for sellers by synthesizing research findings, competitive insights, and internal priorities into actionable UX strategy and design execution. • Facilitate workshops, user testing, and field research to uncover seller needs, validate hypotheses, and inform design directions. • Serve as a primary design lead and mentor for cross-team collaboration, contributing to Figma file development, service-design documentation, and process improvement initiatives. What You'll Bring • 10+ years of professional product design experience, with deep expertise in live commerce, marketplace, or high-velocity seller experiences. • Advanced mastery of Figma, prototyping tools, and interactive design methods, demonstrated through a robust portfolio showcasing end-to-end product design, strategy, and delivery of complex seller-focused solutions across web and native platforms. • Experience delivering compelling executive-level presentations, storytelling, and clear design narratives to influence senior leaders and drive alignment. • Demonstrated ability to architect holistic, scalable design systems and drive cross-domain alignment. • Advanced proficiency in journey mapping, service design documentation, and workshop facilitation. • Proven success influencing product vision, roadmap prioritization, and organizational advocacy for seller needs in a high-growth environment. • Track record of building strong partnerships with content and research peers, and collaborating effectively across cross-functional design, product, engineering, and stakeholder communities. • Experience leading design thinking activities, user-centered research, and qualitative validation within cross-functional squads. • Inclusive, collaborative approach—building trusted relationships and coaching others to foster innovation within and across teams. • Commitment to ongoing learning, mentoring, and advancing design excellence. • Background or deep interest in streaming, live commerce, video-first platforms, or game design. Please see the Talent Privacy Notice for information regarding how eBay handles your personal data collected when you use the eBay Careers website or apply for a job with eBay. eBay is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for accommodation as soon as possible. View our accessibility statement to learn more about eBay's commitment to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities. The eBay Jobs website uses cookies to enhance your experience. By continuing to browse the site, you agree to our use of cookies. Visit our Privacy Center for more information.

title: Digital Product Designer
description: Scope of Position At Alterna, we are reimagining everyday banking to empower the financial futures of our members. The Product Designer (UI/UX) will play a pivotal role in crafting intuitive, delightful, and impactful digital experiences within the Digital Channels Applications team and Alterna Broadly. This role focuses on solving real member problems through human-centered design, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to create user interfaces and experiences that balance user needs, business goals, and technical feasibility. You will own the end-to-end design process for our digital platforms, driving innovation and ensuring seamless, engaging interactions. As a key member of the Digital Channels team. Major Responsibilities UI/UX Design • Design beautiful, intuitive, and accessible user interfaces for web and mobile applications, adhering to iOS, Android, and responsive web design guidelines. • Create wireframes, user flows, interaction prototypes, customer journey maps, and high-fidelity designs to articulate design concepts and solutions. • Develop pixel-perfect design documentation, including annotations, for seamless handoff to developers. • Incorporate motion design and micro-interactions to enhance user engagement and delight. • Translate complex system requirements into simple, user-friendly designs that institutionalize customer-centric practices. • Rapidly prototype concepts using tools like Figma, ranging from low-fidelity sketches to interactive digital prototypes. • Ensure designs align with Alterna’s brand identity and accessibility standards. Research and Validation • Collaborate with stakeholders to conduct qualitative and quantitative research, including user interviews, usability testing, and observational studies. • Apply design thinking to uncover insights, validate design concepts, and iterate based on member feedback and data-driven findings. • Leverage journey maps, service blueprints, and user personas to drive member-centric solutions. Collaboration and Communication • Work closely with stakeholders to align on product vision and ensure design specifications are implemented accurately. • Facilitate design workshops, brainstorming sessions, and process improvement discussions to foster collaboration and innovation. • Communicate design rationale, research findings, and conceptual ideas effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences, including senior leadership. • Partner with developers to ensure technical feasibility and support post-implementation refinements. Process and Support • Own the end-to-end design process, from ideation and prototyping to user testing and final delivery. • Document design processes, technical requirements, and release notes for diverse audiences. • Contribute to the continuous improvement of design workflows and tools within the Digital Channels team. Qualifications Education / Certifications / Experience • University degree in design, human-computer interaction, computer science, or a related field (or equivalent working experience, or working toward a relevant certification). • A minimum of 5 years of experience in UI/UX design, product design, or a related role. • Proven experience launching innovative digital products, with a portfolio showcasing creative, impactful designs (experience in financial services or fintech is a plus). • Proficiency in design tools such as Figma (required), Adobe XD, and Adobe Creative Suite, with experience in prototyping and motion design tools. Competencies • Proactive, “get stuff done” attitude with excellent organizational and time management skills. • Passion for human-centered design with deep empathy for users and a commitment to solving real problems. • Exceptional visual design skills with a strong sense of aesthetics, typography, and motion design. • Ability to balance creativity with strategic thinking, delivering designs that meet both user needs and business objectives. • Strong storytelling and communication skills to articulate design decisions and inspire stakeholders. • Collaborative mindset with the ability to work effectively across cross-functional teams. • Adaptability to shifting priorities and comfort working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. • Excitement for the financial services and fintech sector, with a desire to innovate within digital banking. About Alterna Savings Alterna Savings and Credit Union Limited (Alterna) has delivered The Good in Banking® for over 115 years creating financial services that transform lives for the better, all while giving back to our community. Alterna is made up of Alterna Savings and Credit Union Limited and its wholly owned subsidiary, Alterna Bank. Alterna is the first full-service, member-owned cooperative financial institution outside Quebec, sharing its expertise with over 210,000 members through a network comprised of 40 branches across Ontario, a call centre and multiple digital channels. Members and customers also benefit from an industry-leading online brokerage and investment management services. To learn more about Alterna Savings, please visit alterna.ca, X, Facebook, Instagram, or LinkedIn. Working at Alterna We are incredibly proud of our corporate culture, embodying our core values: Collaboration, Integrity, and Respect, where everyone works together towards a common goal; the financial wellbeing of our employees, members, and customers. This commitment has earned us several prestigious employer awards, including the National Capital Region's Top Employers award for eight years running. • We appreciate all applicants; however, preference will be given to candidates who most closely meet the qualifications, key skills, and competencies outlined above. • Alterna is compliant with the Ontarians with Disabilities Act and our team strives to provide an accessible accommodation experience. If you have a disability and require accommodations during the recruitment process, please contact our Recruitment Team and let us know how we can accommodate you.

title: Senior Product Designer (Hybrid)
description: Hi, Future Homie! At Homebase, you’ll join a team that’s bold, fast-moving, and obsessed with helping small businesses thrive. We build with empathy, act with urgency, and take big swings that drive real-world impact. Here, every Homie shows up to raise the bar, support one another, and celebrate wins as a team. We’re not just building an app—we’re building unstoppable teams. So what do you say, are you in? Your Impact Starts Here As a Senior Product Designer at Homebase, you'll tackle meaningful problems for small businesses and the hourly workers who power them. This role requires someone who can navigate complexity—understanding how workflows connect across a business, knowing when AI can genuinely help and how to apply it, and translating messy real-world constraints into experiences that feel effortless. Where you land will depend on your strengths and our evolving needs, but one thing is certain: you'll own work that matters. Here's how you'll contribute: • Lead with Curiosity: Dive into unfamiliar problem spaces, ask better questions, and bring a genuine eagerness to understand our customers—their constraints, their workarounds, their goals. • Design for Connected Systems: Think beyond individual screens. Our products—scheduling, time tracking, payroll, hiring, team communication—are deeply interconnected. You'll design solutions that make sense within a larger ecosystem, not just in isolation. • Thrive in Ambiguity: Push forward when the path isn't clear. You'll shape direction, not just follow it—bringing structure to fuzzy problems and momentum to early-stage work. • Craft with Intention: Ground your UI decisions in strong UX foundations. Every interaction should help someone get their job done with less friction. • Embrace AI as a Tool: Use AI to accelerate your own work and design experiences where AI genuinely serves the user—not just because it's novel. • Move Fast: Speed is our edge. Prioritize ruthlessly, make decisions, learn, and adapt. The Foundation for Success - These are the experiences and strengths that will set you up for success in this role: • Seasoned Leadership: Demonstrated leadership capabilities, with a track record of inspiring teams and peers, and driving complex projects to success. • Recent native mobile experience: while you won’t be limited to native experiences, recent experience (within the last 3 years) is a significant and critical part of this role. • Master of UI/UX: Exceptional skills in both User Interface and User Experience design, clearly demonstrated through a distinguished portfolio. • Strategic Thinker: Adept at understanding and implementing large-scale business implications of design decisions within the tech landscape. • AI Proficiency: Extensive experience with AI tools in design, enhancing both process and product quality. • Proven experience in platform and messaging product design. • Up-to-date with the latest industry trends and AI technologies. The Homie Way - These principles guide everything we do—from how we work and make decisions to how we show up for each other. • Be Customer Obsessed – Solve problems with empathy and creativity. • Move Fast, Learn Fast – Experiment, take action, and grow every day. • Own Your Impact – Think big, focus on what matters, and make decisions you stand behind. • Master Your Craft – Excellence fuels impact—show up, step up, and make your mark. • Win Together – Put goals over roles, lead with trust, and connect to our mission and each other. What We Offer • Ownership & Financial Security: Stock options + 401(k) with 4% match • Comprehensive Healthcare: Medical, dental, and vision coverage + FSA options • Flexible Time: Unlimited PTO (salaried) + company holidays • Family Support: Up to 12 weeks of paid parental leave (after 6 months of service) • Protection Plans: Life insurance + short/long-term disability coverage • Work Your Way: Work From Anywhere Month + meeting-free weeks yearly • Workspace Perks: Meals provided, commuter benefits, team offsites, and Customer Days • Our Hybrid Rhythm: We believe collaboration drives impact. That’s why Tuesday and Wednesday are our required in-office days—a time to move faster as a team, build deeper connections, make better decisions, and build together. What to Expect During the Interview Process • Meet the Talent Acquisition team. • Meet one of our Design Leaders. • Participate in a Talent Showcase • Meet Cross-functional Partners • Background Check + Offer Stage • Welcome to the team, Homie Belonging at Homebase - We're committed to fostering a welcoming space where every Homie can be their full self. Experience comes in many forms—so if you're excited about this role, even if you don’t meet 100% of the qualifications, we encourage you to apply! Homebase will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Hey, We’re Homebase Unstoppable teams start here. Homebase is the everything app for hourly teams—built to simplify the day-to-day and superpower local businesses. With tools for scheduling, time clocks, payroll, communication, HR, and more, we help teams stay connected and in control. Today, over 100,000 small (but mighty) businesses rely on us to make work radically easier. Together, we’ve tracked over a billion hours for 2.5+ million workers—and we’re just getting started. At Homebase, we celebrate diversity and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We welcome all candidates and do not discriminate based on any legally protected status. If you need accommodations during the hiring process, please let us know—we’re committed to ensuring fair and equitable access for all. Compensation Range: $121.3K - $167.8K

title: Product Designer - Equity + Flexible, Remote Options
description: A growing fintech platform is seeking a Product Designer to tackle design challenges and deliver exceptional product experiences. Candidates should have over 4 years of product design experience, including 2 years at a tech startup, and mastery of Figma. The role requires collaboration with PMs and dev teams to create intuitive product solutions. This position is based in Toronto, with flexibility to work remotely, and offers competitive compensation and various benefits. #J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Product Design Lead
description: We Are: Accenture Song accelerates growth and value for our clients through sustained customer relevance. Our capabilities span the entire journey from ideation to execution, including growth strategies, product and experience design; technology and experience platforms; creative, media, and marketing strategy; as well as campaign, content, and channel orchestration. With strong client relationships and deep industry expertise, we help our clients operate at the speed of life by harnessing the unlimited potential of imagination, technology, and intelligence. Visit us at Accenture Song. Design & Digital Products—a part of Accenture Song—creates value for our clients, their employees, and their customers. We conceptualize, design, and build experiences and services that change the way people work and live. Our team is made up of 300+ employees across the US and Canada. With expertise in service design, experience/product strategy, project management, QA, design thinking, user-experience design/research, and impeccable development for native mobile, web, and embedded systems, we help bring any service or product to life. You Are: A master of your craft. Design Leads bring demonstrable design leadership and expertise to any project and have a proven ability to act as a decisive product owner, mentor, team player, and client partner. Serving as the design lead on simultaneous projects, you can effectively push your teams to deliver exemplary work and exceed client expectations. You are assigned to the more challenging and intensive projects to establish strong, lasting client relationships and are also heavily involved in sales. This role is still very hands-on when needed: as a Design Lead, you create app flows, wireframes, set art direction, and provide development support as necessary, all while keeping your eye on ultimate strategic goals. You thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and relish acting as a mentor to more junior designers. You inspire confidence immediately with clients and are brought in for more challenging or advanced projects to guide and support other designers. You are inspired by innovative web and mobile design and follow the latest design trends. You’re an organized project team player with the ability to streamline amorphous processes and effectively lead the team’s deliverables, responsibilities, and schedule. The Work: • Ensure that best practices are upheld on a project level or through individual mentorship of other designers for their projects. • Demonstrate conviction to champion your perspective while successfully collaborating with other points of view. • Guide the team in experience direction, style, and methodology. • Lead design across simultaneous engagements, overseeing the creative output of a project team or client engagement. • Manage the operations of a project's creative team by setting priorities, assigning resources, and ensuring project goals are achieved. • Lead by example through high engagement and collaboration in group or individual settings and mentorship. • Monitor and drive a project team to utilize the best and latest methods and tools to remain competitive in the industry. • Offer counsel to clients on a consistent basis and be seen as a part of “their” team. • Be extremely comfortable leading and providing structure to potentially ambiguous or evolving processes. • Lead the team’s deliverables, responsibilities, and schedule while maintaining the integrity of the design process. • Explain and sell design decisions to clients and stakeholders. • Be comfortable working as a solo designer, team member, or team lead. • Collaborate effectively with remote and onsite team members, including but not limited to designers, researchers, project/product managers, QA, developers, and technical architects. • Have a Human-Centered Design approach to solving user needs with deep customer empathy. • Apply design thinking to create world-class experiences across multiple platforms and channels by bringing together user needs, business goals, and technical realities. • Translate concepts into designs that create simplicity despite system complexity. • Create instant tangibility for the team and the client through storytelling and rapid prototyping methods, ranging from paper sketching to digital prototyping. • Work directly with customers, peers, and creative leads to design end-to-end experiences using participatory and iterative design techniques, including observational studies, customer interviews, usability testing, and other forms of qualitative and quantitative research to uncover insights, learn about user behavior, and verify design concepts. • Effectively synthesize and communicate research findings, conceptual ideas, detailed designs, and design rationale both verbally and visually. • Work closely with development teams to ensure that design specifications are implemented. • Participate in and contribute to project debriefs, project templates, and design POVs. • Remain hands-on in developing wireframes, user flows, interaction prototypes, user personas, customer journeys, site maps, and other design specification materials. • Help shape opportunities, including estimating, scoping, resourcing, and RFP and/or BD responses. • Effectively demonstrate and document WCAG Accessibility standards during a program.

title: Banking UX Product Designer
description: A leading staffing agency is seeking a Product Designer for a 10-month contract in Toronto, Ontario. This role involves enhancing user experiences for a major Canadian bank's web platform. Responsibilities include iterating products, mentoring designers, and conducting user research. Ideal candidates have 3-4+ years in UX/Product Design, familiarity with Figma and Agile methodologies, and a passion for user-centric solutions. Competitive pay at $56/hr is offered for this position. #J-18808-Ljbffr

title: QA Tester
description: We are looking currently seeking a full-time QA tester to work in our Vaughan location. The QA tester will work closely with the project manager, development and design teams to ensure the software launching is smooth. He/She must have Canadian PR or citizenship. The individual will be responsible for creating a testing plan, performing functional testing and integration testing, and working with developers and customers to resolve bugs and technical issues. It is required to have manual or automation testing experience and know-how to use testing software (Jira and LambdaTest). The software testing contract will be 3-4 months, if candidates are qualified and have software development skills, we can provide a full-time software development job. Job Responsibilities • Write test cases for tracking defects and fixes • Test and certify online systems, the functionality of various websites and mobile applications • Create reviews and test summary reports • Assist development with analysis and verification of software defects reported determining validity and clarification • Perform scenario-based testing from the perspective of various client roles • Analyze and document test results and make recommendations • Test websites across various browsers and mobile devices • Log defects and track them proactively and follow them through to closure • Work with other departments to ensure client expectations of quality are being met • Manage the bug database and backlogs to ensure bug accuracy, priority, status, and severity • Defect logging, tracking, and resolution within Asana throughout the agile development process Requirements • Web-based Testing Experience • Knowledge of QA methodologies and best practices • Proficiency in Functional, Performance and User Interface Testing, Example – testing user-friendliness • Previous work experience in a demanding environment • Effective written and verbal communication skills and ability to work in a team environment • Excellent organization ability and attention to detail • Commitment to delivering high-quality work on time • Knowledge of system development lifecycle principles • Knowledge about Web standards • 1-3 years previous experience with QA, software or testing is an asset • Know frontend language (Html, CSS, vue.js, three.js) and backend language (Java) is an asset • Experience with test case management software, like TestRal • Must be available to periodically work overtime or on weekends, depending on project needs

Candidates should have 8+ years of testing experience and strong written and verbal communication skills. The role involves reviewing test requirements, logging defects, and supporting the Quality Assurance Manager. This is a great opportunity for those experienced in a regulated product environment. #J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Senior Software Developer in Test – AI/Automation
description: Job Description What is the opportunity? We’re building a team who is not afraid to challenge the status quo; embraces innovation; and excited to bring a fresh perspective. You will be part of our fast-paced team and help modernize how we approach our work and update our practices with the latest technology and a particular focus on adoption of AI to achieve those goals. This is a highly technical role that requires strong hands-on expertise combined with strong communication and leadership skills. You will be required to solve systemic challenges which have impeded our ability to be agile and push changes to production quickly and apply your expertise where needed, blurring the line between traditional roles. What will you do? • Design and implement advanced test automation and AI-driven test solution to enhance test coverage and quality and to achieve what has been traditionally view as not feasible. • Develop and promote high and reliable code quality to promote maintainability and reusability. • Integrate tools into enterprise DevOps pipelines to enable more end-to-end automation of integration, functional and performance testing. • Enhance and support applications, by designing, developing, reviewing and maintaining test automation code for applications based on industry standards and best practices (AI or automation tools) • Collaborate with business, operations and technology teams and participates in all phases of the project life cycles (requirements, design, development, testing) to align on test strategy to improve code quality. • Work closely with the application development team in an integrated one-team fashion to advance quality engineering processes into the workflows. • Understand the strategic imperatives of the organization and our department and identify opportunities to further those objectives as part of project work. • Contentiously assess and adopt emerging technologies to drive test innovation and adopt best practices. What do you need to succeed? Must-have • Excellent communication skills, including the ability to understand and express complex topics. • Ability to rapidly learn new technologies and programming languages. • Passionately embraces and leveraged AI technologies with a desire to challenge the status quo in a constructive. • Must have Technologies: GitHub Actions, Java, Spring Boot, javascript, Gherkin, Cucumber, Kafka, MQ, Selenium, playwright, wiremock. • Must understand concepts: BDD, TDD, Shift-left, Mocks and Stubs, Service Virtualization, Synthetic Data, CI/CD/CT. • 5+ years of experience in Java and Spring Boot Framework. • Must have a University/College graduate in computer science or engineering with 5+ years of experience working withing the application development process. • Understand software design lifecycle, principles in architecture, design patterns and the different types of tests. Nice-to-have • Hands on experience with Cloud Technologies and Platforms (OpenShift, Docker, Kubernetes, etc.). • Experience with Elasticsearch, Logstash, and Kibana (ELK) stack, UrbanCodeDeploy and DynaTrace. • Working knowledge in Mainframe z/OS technologies such as JCL, TSO/ISPF, On Demand, ZEKE, RACF. What's in for you? We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team • A world-class training program in financial services • Flexible work/life balance options • Opportunities to do challenging work #LI-ASPOST #TechPJ Job Skills Application Testing, Decision Making, Detail-Oriented, Group Problem Solving, IT Quality Assurance, Long Term Planning, Predictive Analytics, Programming Languages, Software Product Testing, Test Automation Additional Job Details Address: RBC WATERPARK PLACE, 88 QUEENS QUAY W:TORONTO City: Toronto Country: Canada Work hours/week: 37.5 Employment Type: Full time Platform: TECHNOLOGY AND OPERATIONS Job Type: Regular Pay Type: Salaried Posted Date: 2025-11-26 Application Deadline: 2025-12-11 Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the application deadline date above Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment At RBC, we believe an inclusive workplace that has diverse perspectives is core to our continued growth as one of the largest and most successful banks in the world. Maintaining a workplace where our employees feel supported to perform at their best, effectively collaborate, drive innovation, and grow professionally helps to bring our Purpose to life and create value for our clients and communities. RBC strives to deliver this through policies and programs intended to foster a workplace based on respect, belonging and opportunity for all. Join our Talent Community Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you. Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at jobs.rbc.com.
highlights: RBC WATERPARK PLACE, 88 QUEENS QUAY W:TORONTOTECHNOLOGY AND OPERATIONSNote: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the application deadline date above Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment At RBC, we believe an inclusive workplace that has diverse perspectives is core to our continued growth as one of the largest and most successful banks in the world. Maintaining a workplace where our employees feel supported to perform at their best, effectively collaborate, drive innovation, and grow professionally helps to bring our Purpose to life and create value for our clients and communities. RBC strives to deliver this through policies and programs intended to foster a workplace based on respect, belonging and opportunity for all. Join our Talent Community Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you. Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at jobs.rbc.com.

title: BI & ETL Tester - Hybrid
description: Software International (SI) supplies technical talent to a variety of clients ranging from Fortune 100/500/1000 companies to small and mid-sized organizations in Canada/US and Europe. We currently have a multiple, re-extendable, long term contract roles as a BI & ETL Tester - Hybrid with our global SAP consulting client, working onsite at large CPG/Entertainment client's office 2-3 days a week in dwontown, Toronto. This is a 6 month contract initially, but will be extended long term. Role: BI & ETL Tester - Hybrid Type: Contract # of Roles: 1 Duration: 9-12 months to start + possible extensions Location: Toronto, ON - Hybrid, 2-3 days onsite in downtown Toronto Rate: Open based on expectations as a C2C contractor Overview We are seeking a skilled BI & ETL Tester to validate, analyze, and ensure the accuracy, performance, and reliability of data pipelines, BI reports, dashboards, and analytics solutions. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in data validation, SQL, ETL process testing, and working with modern data platforms. Key Responsibilities 1. ETL / Data Pipeline Testing • Validate end-to-end ETL workflows including data extraction, transformation, and loading. • Perform source-to-target data validation, record counts, reconciliation, schema checks, and transformation logic checks. • Test data ingestion from multiple sources (databases, files, SAP, cloud platforms). • Verify scheduling, dependencies, and error-handling processes in ETL jobs. • Conduct regression, functional, and sanity testing for data loads. 2. BI / Reporting Testing • Validate BI reports and dashboards for accuracy, formatting, filters, drill-downs, KPIs, and aggregations. • Compare visual outputs with backend data using SQL queries. • Test performance, data refresh cycles, row-level security, and report-level access. 3. SQL & Data Quality Validation • Write complex SQL queries to validate business rules, calculations, and data transformations. • Identify data issues, anomalies, and integrity gaps. • Collaborate with Data Engineers, BI Developers, and Data Analyst to resolve defects. 4. Test Planning & Execution • Create detailed test plans, test cases, test scenarios, and acceptance criteria. • Perform manual testing and assist in setting up automated testing frameworks (e.g., Python, PyTest, dbt tests). • Document defects in tools like JIRA and follow through to closure. • Participate in sprint planning, reviews, and Agile ceremonies. Required Skills & Experience • 510+ years of BI/ETL testing or QA experience. • Strong SQL skills (joins, window functions, aggregations, CTEs). • Experience testing ETL tools such as: Airflow • Experience with BI tools: • Power BI, SAP BO, etc. • Understanding of data warehousing (Star/Snowflake schema, dimensions, facts). • Knowledge of cloud data platforms ( GCP is a plus). • Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodology. • Experience in defect management and test documentation tools. Preferred Qualifications • Experience with SAP source systems (SAP ECC, S/4HANA, SAP BW, SAP IBP) for data validation. • Exposure to big data technologies (BigQuery). • Automation experience using Python or SQL-based frameworks. • Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines for data testing. • Experience with version control (Git). Soft Skills • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. • Excellent communication with business and technical teams. • Ability to work independently and manage multiple assignments. • Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and quality.

title: Test Lead
description: Requisition ID: 239812 Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture. As a Senior QA Analyst within the Smart Automation Team, you will lead quality assurance efforts across automation solutions. You will be responsible for defining testing strategies, managing test execution, and ensuring alignment with business and technical requirements. This role demands strong expertise in testing methodologies, automation tools, and patch validation, along with the ability to mentor junior QA team members and collaborate across cross-functional teams. Is this role right for you? Define and manage end-to-end QA strategies for automation and software projects. Collaborate with Business Analysts and Developers to interpret requirements and translate them into comprehensive test plans and acceptance criteria. Lead test execution across functional, regression, integration, and system testing phases. Oversee defect lifecycle management using tools such as Jira, ensuring timely resolution and retesting. Perform advanced API testing using Postman and RestAssured, validating RESTful and GraphQL endpoints. Conduct backend data validation and ensure data integrity across integrated systems. Manage patch testing activities, including regression validation post-patch and coordination with infrastructure teams. Support and guide User Acceptance Testing (UAT), including test data preparation and execution oversight. Provide risk-based recommendations for release approvals based on test outcomes. Promote early testing and defect prevention strategies throughout the development lifecycle. Participate in retrospectives and root cause analysis to improve QA processes and reduce defect leakage. Maintain QA documentation including test cases, scripts, and knowledge repositories. Act as a quality ambassador, ensuring alignment on testing goals across teams. Communicate test progress, risks, and issues to stakeholders at all levels. Integrate testing into CI/CD pipelines and support DevOps initiatives. Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field. Minimum 5+ years of experience in software QA, with a focus on automation and enterprise systems. Automation testing experience with tools like selenium, UiPath test Suite will be considered as an asset. Hands-on experience with automation tools and frameworks such as Selenium, UiPath, WorkFusion, and Pega OpenSpan will be an Asset. Strong knowledge of API testing protocols including REST, GraphQL, Postman, and RestAssured. Experience with patch validation and regression testing post-infrastructure updates. Proficiency in manual and automated testing techniques. Solid understanding of Agile, Scrum, and DevOps methodologies. Strong communication and leadership skills. Certifications (preferred but not mandatory): o ISTQB Certified Tester o UiPath Certified RPA Associate What's in it for you? • Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Allyship - We strive to create an inclusive culture where every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are, and are embraced through bias-free practices and inclusive values across Scotiabank. We embrace diversity and provide opportunities for all employee to learn, grow & participate through our various Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) that span across diverse gender identities, ethnicity, race, age, ability & veterans. • Accessibility and Workplace Accommodations - We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Scotiabank continues to locate, remove and prevent barriers so that we can build a diverse and inclusive environment while meeting accessibility requirements. • Upskilling through online courses, cross-functional development opportunities, and tuition assistance. • Competitive Rewards program including bonus, flexible vacation, personal, sick days and benefits will start on day one. • Community Engagement - no matter where you choose to work from; we offer opportunities for community engagement & belonging with our various programs such as hackathons, contests, cooking with friends, Humans of Digital and much more! Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets. At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Software Tester (QA)
description: Not your everyday quality assurance position. Challenging and fast-moving, yet friendly and supportive: a career you will look forward to every day. Work with intelligent people in an exciting environment where every month is different. Positions Available: • 2-3 positions, ranging from junior up to senior (based on skill and potential skill, regardless of the amount of experience or education). • Additional positions for specialists . Tell us your strengths in your cover letter and we'll go from there. • Other Positions : We are also hiring for other positions (technical support, software developer, business analysts). You may apply for multiple positions separately. If you know someone in any of these areas, please do them a quick and friendly favour by letting them know about this posting. Position Overview: • Full time and permanent • Flexible hours (for example: choose to start your day between 6am and 10am, work late some days and shorter on others). • Fast moving in terms of variety of tasks and expectations. • Complex ever-expanding software is what is being tested, rather than something mundane or where the product hasn't really changed much from one month to another. • Opportunity to work closely with a wide range of dynamic colleagues , from project managers and business analysts to software development teams. • Play a meaningful role in monitoring and testing our products throughout the development process and beyond, identifying and flagging potential issues before they impact our clients. Quality assurance is key to maintaining and expanding our company's reputation for reliability and client satisfaction. • Be heard throughout a project's entire lifecycle, with your ideas and feedback welcomed at every stage. • Perform rapid assessment when issues are escalated from customer support, prioritizing and coordinating the troubleshooting process. • Develop test plans that can streamline and standardize practices on current and existing projects. • Contribute to technical support, training, helping craft support documents and conduct training sessions with clients. • Work with development teams to design and monitor automated tests for our clients' custom apps. • Opportunity to be an innovator with impact by finding new strategies to help us better serve our clients. • Gain valuable career experience in a variety of industries and project types. • Mentoring from experienced project managers and business analysts. • Perform post-mortem analysis on each bug to determine reasonableness of the development that led to it. • Opportunity for advancement and job evolution into a variety of potential positions. • Does not become repetitive or boring, because you'll engage with a wide array of software. • Does not require evening or weekend work, except in very rare crunch times. Requirements: • Intelligence and creativity • Varied personal experience using web and mobile applications. • Superb communication and language skills, both written and verbal. • Creativity at identifying product issues and guiding solutions. • Passion for finding software solutions for client needs. • Pride in work. • Reasonably solid Excel skills. • No specific requirements for formal education or industry experience. We evaluate each applicant based on merit and potential rather than formalities. Nice To Have: • Ability to see opportunities for improvement everywhere. • Pragmatic approach to balancing perfectionism with getting the job done. • Strong technical skills. • Expert-level Excel skills. About The Work Environment: • Friendly , non-threatening, and non-political environment. • Mid-sized company but retaining the speed and flexibility of a smaller company. • We are a great environment for both outgoing people and those who are very shy and introverted (applicable to non-client facing positions). • We strive to have every employee sitting near a window for natural light and to have plenty of plants throughout the office; we care about employee health. • Free onsite massage therapy. • Private nap rooms for isolated thinking time or for taking a nap if you didn’t sleep well last night. • Atrium to enjoy the sun during lunch. • Social events worth remembering (fencing competitions, curling, video game or board game parties, coding competitions, commando combat training, robotics club coming soon, etc). • An example of our culture: Lunch together is in a very comfy sofa room, and even the quiet types are comfortable there. • Unlimited access to pillage our kitchens for caffeine, sugar, healthy snacks, soups, and more :) • Additional perks that are cost-shared like motorized sit-stand desks. • Task focused: everyone in the company heavily uses centralized to-do lists to stay organized, prioritize, and coordinate. • Fast paced • Consistent work/life balance: mandatory overtime is very rare.

title: Siebel Tester
description: Position: Siebel Tester Location: Toronto, ON Duration: 1 Year Responsibilities: • Provides advice on the testing strategy, test plans, the selection of testing tools, and the identification of resources required for testing Plans and organizes testing efforts for large systems in Graphical User Interface (GUI) and non-Graphical User Interface (GUI) environments, including the execution of systems integration tests, specialized tests, and user acceptance testing (e.g., stress tests) The Quality Assurance Specialist is responsible for the development of test plans, test scripts and test cases and executing these against the various components. The tester will work with the testing lead and IT lead of each project as well as the project team members in the analysis, design, development, implementation and ongoing support of the required systems General Skills: • Experience in planning, organizing and implementing testing efforts at the specified experience level Knowledge of structured methodologies for the development, design, implementation and maintenance of applications Knowledge and experience in the use of Computer Aided Software Engineering (CASE) tools and data query tools to aid in the development of test cases Knowledge and experience in the use of automated test tools and version control systems on one or more platforms Experience executing functional tests, non-functional tests and systems level integration tests Experience supporting user acceptance testing and participating in UAT activities Experience with quality assurance principles, practices, tools and structured methodologies Experience creating testing strategy documentation, test plans, test cases and test data for various types and phases of testing, including technical and business functional validation Experience in quality assurance and testing, including unit testing, integration testing, load testing, performance testing, etc. Knowledge and experience in all phases of the Systems Development Life Cycle Excellent analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills; organizational, creativity and perseverance skills; verbal and written communication skills; and interpersonal skills A team player with a track record for meeting deadlines Knowledge of one or more automated testing tools Desirable Skills: • Knowledge and experience in at least one programming language Experience in the use of information retrieval packages Knowledge and understanding of testing methods in an object-oriented environment Knowledge and understanding of Information Management principles, concepts, policies and practices. Knowledge and understanding of Accessibility for Ontarians with Disability Act (AODA) and related regulations and standards Experience planning and organizing testing efforts for both large and small systems Experience coding automated test scripts to produce sets of automated test cases Experience testing Commercial Off-the Shelf Applications (COTS) Must Have: • 8+ years of experience working as a Software QA Tester • 5+ years of experience testing a Commercial Off the Shelf (COTS) Application • Experience testing Oracle Siebel CRM application is a strong asset • Experience working on Siebel Test Automation is an asset • Experience testing Adobe AEM is an asset Warm Regards, Ashwini Sinha | Team Lead Email- Ashwini.sinha@vlinkinfo.com O: 8609600605 EXT- 200 C: 16155924568

title: Senior Software Testing Engineer
description: About the Role We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Software Testing Engineer to lead advanced validation efforts across Neural Processing Unit (NPU) software, AI workloads, Windows AI features, and machine learning quantization workflows. This role focuses on ensuring software stability, certification readiness, and optimal performance across next-generation Windows AI platforms. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including firmware, driver, software, and Microsoft engineering partners. Key Duties & Responsibilities • Perform comprehensive software validation of NPU-related firmware, drivers, and execution layers to ensure performance, functionality, and power efficiency meet certification requirements. • Participate in certification processes for the NPU Execution Provider (NPU EP) to ensure compatibility and reliability within Microsoft AI frameworks. • Generate detailed test reports, log defects, and provide actionable feedback to firmware, driver, and software teams to improve throughput, stability, and feature compliance. • Validate AI workloads running on NPU hardware, focusing on software-level performance, scalability, and stability under varying test conditions. • Collaborate with Microsoft engineering teams to certify DirectML Execution Provider (DML EP) functionality and ensure alignment with AI workload requirements. • Debug and troubleshoot AI inference and training pipelines during validation to ensure smooth software integration on Windows AI platforms. • Conduct functional, performance, and security testing of Windows AI Copilot features built for NPU-enabled devices. • Validate end-to-end user scenarios across Co-Pilot applications such as Paint Co-Creator, Live Translation, Recall, and Settings Agent. • Analyze software telemetry, system logs, and user feedback to identify defects and collaborate with development teams for timely issue resolution. • Develop, implement, and validate software-based quantization methods using the Olive toolchain and other AI frameworks to optimize model size while maintaining accuracy. • Perform quantization-aware validation to ensure models meet required quality and performance benchmarks on resource-constrained platforms. • Benchmark quantized models across multiple hardware targets and AI workloads to verify consistency, compatibility, and certification readiness. Qualifications • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field. • 5–10+ years of experience in software testing, validation, or quality engineering (ideally in AI, ML, or NPU systems). • Strong understanding of machine learning frameworks, AI workload execution, and performance testing. • Hands-on experience with Windows platform testing, hardware-software integration, and debugging tools. • Familiarity with quantization methods, ONNX, DirectML, Olive, or similar ML toolchains (preferred). • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills; ability to collaborate with global engineering teams. Job Type: Full-time Pay: From $80,000.00 per year Benefits: • Casual dress • Company events • Dental care • Disability insurance • Employee assistance program • Extended health care • Life insurance • On-site parking • Paid time off • RRSP match • Vision care • Wellness program Work Location: In person

title: Web Designer
description: Not your everyday web designer position. Challenging with great variety, yet friendly and calm: a job you will look forward to every day. Work with intelligent people in an exciting environment where every month is different. Positions Available: • Full time web designer . • We are also hiring for other positions (including front-end web developers, graphic designers, motion graphic animators, UX designers, and marketing project managers). If you know someone in any of these areas, please do them a quick and friendly favour by letting them know about this posting. Position Overview: • Full time and permanent. • Flexible hours (for example: choose to start your day between 6am and 10am, work late some days and shorter on others). • 80% internal projects (for multiple product lines), 20% client projects. • Focus on achieving noticeably remarkable and portfolio-worthy results , with only some projects that simply need to be done in a short timeframe. • Generally, you will get a variety of three types of work , as listed below. • Website concept ideation for numerous in-house brands including Pleasant Solutions itself and our products, and tweaking the concept to greatness. • Production design and development of the websites in hand-coded HTML, starting from scratch and starting with a stock template you select. • Design and consulting for clients , typically as add-ons to technical client projects. Some of these are short-term projects such as redesigning homepages or designing the look of a web application. • Engage in constructive debate to challenge your editorial decisions; standing up for your choices, while being willing to use respectful criticism, with or without the sugar coating, to iterate into even better designs. • Explore and be inventive using A/B testing methodology to create test variations, request resulting data from the analytics team, and iterate until we discover new ways to reach peek results for mission critical webpages. • Collaboration and support within a department including user experience (UX) designers, graphic designers, writer team, video team, and SEO team. • Environment allows for some privacy at your workstation as well as time to concentrate without distractions when you need it. • High end equipment to work with (triple monitors with a 40” monitor, whatever keyboard or mouse you want us to buy, etc.). • Does not involve constant tight deadlines nor overtime that lead to results you are not proud of; there is pressure but it is manageable and work has steady hours. • Does not involve wasteful bureaucracy or processes. • Does not recreate creating your own graphic assets, although you can contribute as your skills permit. Requirements: • Extensive knowledge of web design, including HMTL, CSS, and responsive layouts. • Very strong aesthetic sensibilities. • Passionate about design, with a deep appreciation for how it can impact usability and user experience. • Excellent communication skills, with English fluency. • Excited to dive into challenges, and will persevere at length to achieve victory. • Javascript programming abilities not required (although any Javascript skills would be useful if you have them) • No specific requirements for formal education or industry experience. We evaluate each applicant based on merit rather than formalities and we accept that some candidates might be new to a couple of the areas we have mentioned. Nice To Have: • Ability to see opportunities for improvement everywhere. • Strong technical skills. • Graphic design skills to complement your web design prowess. • Experience working at a creative agency or web design studio of some kind. About The Work Environment: • Friendly , non-threatening, and non-political environment. • Mid-sized company but retaining the speed and flexibility of a smaller company. • We are a great environment for both outgoing people and those who are very shy and introverted (applicable to non-client facing positions). • We strive to have every employee sitting near a window for natural light and to have plenty of plants throughout the office; we care about employee health. • Free onsite massage therapy. • Private nap rooms for isolated thinking time or for taking a nap if you didn’t sleep well last night. • Atrium to enjoy the sun during lunch. • Social events worth remembering (fencing competitions, curling, video game or board game parties, coding competitions, commando combat training, robotics club coming soon, etc). • An example of our culture: Lunch together is in a very comfy sofa room, and even the quiet types are comfortable there. • Unlimited access to pillage our kitchens for caffeine, sugar, healthy snacks, soups, and more :) • Additional perks that are cost-shared like motorized sit-stand desks. • Task focused: everyone in the company heavily uses centralized to-do lists to stay organized, prioritize, and coordinate. • Fast paced • Consistent work/life balance: mandatory overtime is very rare.

Social events (fencing competitions, curling, video game or board game parties, coding competitions, commando combat training, An example of our culture: is in a very comfy sofa room, and even the quiet types are comfortable there. Unlimited access to pillage our kitchens for caffeine, sugar, healthy snacks, soups, and more :) Additional perks that are cost-shared like motorized sit-stand desks. Task focused: everyone in the company heavily uses centralized to-do lists to stay organized, prioritize, and coordinate. Fast paced Consistent work/life balance: mandatory overtime is very rare.

title: Web & Graphics Designer
description: Job Summary We are seeking a talented and creative Web and Graphic Designer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing visually compelling designs that align with brand strategies and marketing goals. This role involves working on various digital and print projects, including UI design, motion graphics, logo creation, and visual branding. The Graphic Designer will collaborate closely with marketing and development teams to produce engaging content that enhances our company's visual identity. Duties • Design and develop engaging graphics for digital platforms, including websites, social media, and email campaigns using tools like Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, Sketch, and InVision. • Create compelling UI/UX designs for web applications and mobile interfaces with a focus on user experience and accessibility. • Produce motion graphics and animations using Adobe After Effects to enhance video content and presentations. • Develop logos, branding materials, and visual assets that reflect the company's identity across various media. • Collaborate with marketing teams to craft visual content supporting campaigns, product launches, and promotional activities. • Maintain consistency in design language by adhering to brand guidelines and style standards. • Assist in website updates and maintenance using WordPress, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript as needed. • Prepare presentation materials with strong typography and layout skills for internal and external use. • Stay updated on industry trends in digital design, typography, and visual storytelling to continually improve the quality of work. Requirements • Proven experience in graphic design with a strong portfolio showcasing digital design, motion graphics, logo creation, and UI/UX projects. • Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign), After Effects, Figma, Sketch, CorelDRAW, and InVision. • Knowledge of web technologies including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, WordPress integration is preferred. • Strong understanding of typography, color theory, layout principles, and visual storytelling techniques. • Experience designing for marketing campaigns across multiple channels with excellent presentation skills. • Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team environment. • Excellent communication skills to articulate design concepts clearly and effectively. • A degree in Graphic Design, Visual Arts or related field is preferred but not mandatory if accompanied by a strong portfolio. This position offers an exciting opportunity to contribute creatively within a professional environment that values innovation and quality design work. Job Type: Fixed term contract Contract length: 8 months Pay: $40,000.00-$50,000.00 per year Work Location: In person
